page.title: 16PETS
page.content: The most common pets to be found in this area are dogs and cats. Popular breads amongst the former are Labradors, Collies, Spaniels and Golden Retrievers, while cats are more often of mixed breeds though one can see the short haired Siamese and Burmese occasionally and the long haired Persian breeds. Among small caged animals, Guinea Pigs, and Hamsters are popular. Rabbits, more varied than their wild counterparts, are sometimes given quite large areas of freedom. Many coloured Budgerigars are popular birds bred in captivity and insecure if released. Although not really 'pets' the occasional Chicken or Lamb has become tame and part of the household. Some Geese are used as 'guards'. The most unusual pets we have encountered are a Donkey, a Stoat, and two Lucas Terriers.
